attributes.action: put pressure on the highways agency to action resurfacing of the remainder of the A180
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A large proportion of the A180 which runs from Barnetby into Grimsby (also serving the port of Immingham) suffers from cracks, ruts and potholes, some two to three inches deep.  The road has to support thousands of lorries every day.

The bulk of these potholes and cracks are between the junctions at Ulceby (Brocklesby Interchange) and Barnetby (Barnetby Interchange) although there are severe ruts in the tarmac surface on the inside lane of the M180 between Barnetby and Scunthorpe.

These cracks and potholes not only affect a driver's ability to control their vehicle but also cause damage to tyres and wheels.

The road is also extremely noisy.

All our local MPs have expressed concern and support for the resurfacing of the remainder of the road to be resurfaced in the local Newspaper.

The road is now of a very poor standard and needs resurfacing with a material suitable for the amount of traffic it is carrying, which will also minimise the noise pollution affecting both drivers and nearby residents.
